paragraphs.body: La, also known as the Ocean Spirit, is one of two spirits which reside in the ${link_0} in the ${link_1}'s capital city at the ${link_2}. La's physical form resembles a black koi fish with a large white spot on its head, she and her counterpart, ${link_3}, circle each other in an eternal dance of pushing and pulling.
paragraphs.text: La, also known as the Ocean Spirit, is one of two spirits which reside in the Spirit Oasis in the Northern Water Tribe's capital city at the North Pole. La's physical form resembles a black koi fish with a large white spot on its head, she and her counterpart, Tui, circle each other in an eternal dance of pushing and pulling.

paragraphs.body: Thousands of years before the ${link_0}, La and Tui decided to manifest themselves into the physical ${link_1} to benefit mankind, taking up residence in an alcove of the Northern Water Tribe's capital city. They created the oasis in the North Pole and took the form of two koi fish. Thus, the Spirit Oasis in the city became its most treasured landmark.
paragraphs.text: Thousands of years before the Hundred Year War, La and Tui decided to manifest themselves into the physical world to benefit mankind, taking up residence in an alcove of the Northern Water Tribe's capital city. They created the oasis in the North Pole and took the form of two koi fish. Thus, the Spirit Oasis in the city became its most treasured landmark.

paragraphs.body: ${link_0} and the Ocean Spirit wiped out the ${link_1} ${link_2}.
paragraphs.text: Aang and the Ocean Spirit wiped out the Fire Nation Navy.

paragraphs.body: Centuries later, the ${link_0} initiated a ${link_1}, during which ${link_2} ${link_3} captured and killed Tui, the Moon Spirit. With her counterpart gone, La was left swimming frantically around in the pool. ${link_4}, making eye contact with La, entered the ${link_5} and walked into the water of the Spirit Oasis, where the Ocean Spirit started swimming around him. The two fused to form Koizilla, a colossal fish-like figure. Together, they quickly annihilated the Fire Nation land forces and ${link_6} fleet with their superior ${link_7}. When La noticed that Tui had been revived by ${link_8} ${link_9}'s sacrifice, the spirit ceased his destructive rampage and separated from Aang, leaving him at the city's ice walls, and returned to the Spirit Oasis. On his way, he encountered a dueling Zhao and Zuko; to avenge the attack on Tui, the Ocean Spirit formed an arm out of water and dragged Zhao below, never to resurface again.

links.body: siege on the Northern Water Tribe

paragraphs.text: Centuries later, the Fire Nation initiated a siege on the Northern Water Tribe, during which Admiral Zhao captured and killed Tui, the Moon Spirit. With her counterpart gone, La was left swimming frantically around in the pool. Aang, making eye contact with La, entered the Avatar State and walked into the water of the Spirit Oasis, where the Ocean Spirit started swimming around him. The two fused to form Koizilla, a colossal fish-like figure. Together, they quickly annihilated the Fire Nation land forces and navy fleet with their superior waterbending. When La noticed that Tui had been revived by Princess Yue's sacrifice, the spirit ceased his destructive rampage and separated from Aang, leaving him at the city's ice walls, and returned to the Spirit Oasis. On his way, he encountered a dueling Zhao and Zuko; to avenge the attack on Tui, the Ocean Spirit formed an arm out of water and dragged Zhao below, never to resurface again.

paragraphs.body: Koizilla was the being that La became when she joined with Aang in the Avatar State. Admiral Zhao thought that in order to conquer the Northern Water Tribe, he would have to eliminate the moon by killing the mortal form of the Moon Spirit, Tui. He went to the Spirit Oasis and killed the white koi fish, which consequently darkened the moon and rendered ${link_0} helpless. Furious, Aang entered the Avatar State, waded into the water, and merged with the Ocean Spirit, La, forming Koizilla. Made entirely of water and light, this destructive creature is literally the wrath of the ocean in physical form. Koizilla ventured throughout the Northern Water Tribe and wiped out dozens of Fire Nation soldiers and tanks before taking out Zhao's Fire Nation fleet. After seeing that Tui was alive again because of Yue's sacrifice, Koizilla separated back into Aang and La. As La retreated to the oasis, she grabbed Zhao, who was fighting ${link_1}, and pulled him below the surface of the water and into the ${link_2}, where she imprisoned him in the ${link_3}.
paragraphs.text: Koizilla was the being that La became when she joined with Aang in the Avatar State. Admiral Zhao thought that in order to conquer the Northern Water Tribe, he would have to eliminate the moon by killing the mortal form of the Moon Spirit, Tui. He went to the Spirit Oasis and killed the white koi fish, which consequently darkened the moon and rendered waterbenders helpless. Furious, Aang entered the Avatar State, waded into the water, and merged with the Ocean Spirit, La, forming Koizilla. Made entirely of water and light, this destructive creature is literally the wrath of the ocean in physical form. Koizilla ventured throughout the Northern Water Tribe and wiped out dozens of Fire Nation soldiers and tanks before taking out Zhao's Fire Nation fleet. After seeing that Tui was alive again because of Yue's sacrifice, Koizilla separated back into Aang and La. As La retreated to the oasis, she grabbed Zhao, who was fighting Zuko, and pulled him below the surface of the water and into the Spirit World, where she imprisoned him in the Fog of Lost Souls.
